title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | SB 1.17.24 Part 1 | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | 05-03-2023
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyanati Mirandasya Gyananjanishalakaya
Chaksharunmilitam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Namah Om Vishnupadaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale
Shri Mate Bhakti Vedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine
Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pashchatya Deshatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda
Shri Advaita Gadadhara Sri Vasadi Gaurabhakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya
Naram Chai Vanarottamam Deveem Saraswateem
Vyasam Tato Jayam Udi Rayet
In this session we will be discussing from the 24th verse of the 17th chapter
of the 1st canto of Shri Madbhagavatam
Tapashaucham Dayasatyam Iti Pada Kriteyam
Kriyate Krutah Adharmam Shais Trayobhagna
Smaya Sanga Madais Tava
The meaning of this verse is
In the age of Satya, truthfulness, your four legs were established by the four principles
of austerity, cleanliness, mercy and truthfulness.
But it appears that three of your legs are broken due to rampant irreligion in the form
of pride, lust for women and intoxication.
So Parikshit Maharaj is speaking to the personality of religious principle dharma, the bull in
the shape of the bow.
That dharma in the beginning of the cycle of four yugas in Satya yuga was established
on four legs, four pillars of dharma, what are they austerity, cleanliness, mercy and
truthfulness.
Tapaha, Shaucham, Daya, Satyam.
Tapa means austerity, Shaucham means cleanliness, Daya means mercy, Satyam means truthfulness.
But by the time the ages rotate, time passes by, Satya, Treta, Dwapara, Kali.
So from Satya yuga to Treta yuga.
One of the leg is broken.
Then from Treta yuga to Dwapara yuga, transition, one more leg is broken.
And from Dwapara yuga to Kali yuga, yet one more pillar of religion is broken.
So in Kali yuga, at the beginning of Kali yuga, Dharma is left with only one principle
that is truthfulness.
The other three principles.
and mercy are broken. Now, how are they broken? It is described here, they are broken due to
rampant irreligion in the form of pride, lust for women and intoxication. So, Prabhupada explains
this in the purport very nicely. In the purport, Srila Prabhupada says, the deluding energy or
material nature can act upon the living beings proportionately in terms of the living beings
falling prey to the deluding attraction of maya. We are in the material world, the material energy,
maya is acting. But maya's action or influence is possible only if we become attracted by maya's
allurements to enjoy.
Engage in sinful activities. Otherwise, if we refrain from sinful activities, particularly in Kali Yuga,
four kinds of sinful activities. Intoxication, meat eating, illicit sex and gambling. If we refrain from
these four pillars of sinful life, then we are in the material world. We are in the material world.
Then, we can remain aloof from the influence of maya. So, that will be explained now by Srila Prabhupada
in a little more detail. Prabhupada says, there is a standard example given in the scriptures.
Moths are captivated by the glaring brightness of light and thus they become prey to the fire.
Similarly, the deluding energy, deluding energy means the energy which influences us to become
illusioned, is always captivating the conditioned souls to become prey to the fire of delusion.
And the various scriptures warn the conditioned souls not to become prey to delusion, but to get
rid of it.
Don't get attracted.
Don't get captivated by some, some illusion, illusory energies, illusory energies display of some
opportunity for enjoyment in sinful ways. Don't get captivated.
The Vedas warn us,
not to go to the darkness of ignorance, but to the progressive path of light, tamasoma jyotir gama.
Tamasoma.
Don't remain in darkness or don't go more into darkness. Come out of darkness and go towards light.
The Lord himself also warns that the deluding power of material energies is too powerful to overcome.
Daivi, Hesha, Gunamayi, Mamamaya, Durakyaya.
It's too powerful.
Durakyaya.
But one who completely surrenders unto the Lord can easily do so, can easily actually overcome.
Ma mevaye prapadyante maya metam tarantite.
But to surrender unto the lotus feet of the Lord is also not very easy.
Such surrender is possible by persons of austerity, cleanliness, mercy, and truthfulness.
So on the one side are four things.
So on the one side are four pillars of sinful life.
The deluding energy, the illusory energy is attracting the conditioned souls come enjoy in sinful ways.
Other side are the four pillars of religion, religious principles.
Now simply avoiding sinful activities alone does not enable a person to surrender to Krishna.
That is required.
In addition to avoiding sinful activities one has to practice the principles of austerity, cleanliness, mercy, and truthfulness.
Then it is possible to surrender to Krishna.
And by surrendering to Krishna one can overcome the influence of the illusory energy completely.
These four principles of advanced civilization were remarkable features in the age of Satya.
The first age in the cycle of four yugas.
Satya Yuga.
In that age every human being was practically a qualified Brahman of the highest order.
And in the social orders of life they were all Paramahamsas or the topmost in the renounced order.
All human beings were of the topmost class in the Satya Yuga.
By cultural standing the human beings were not at all subjected to deluding energy.
They were not affected by Maya in Satya Yuga.
All the human beings.
Such strong men of character were competent enough to get away from the clutches of Maya.
But gradually as the principles of Brahmanical culture.
What are the principles of Brahmanical culture?
Austerity.
Cleanliness.
Mercy.
Truthfulness.
Austerity is Tapa.
Shaucham.
Tapa is austerity.
Shaucham is cleanliness.
Daya is mercy.
Satya is truthfulness.
As these principles became curtailed.
By proportionate development of pride, attachment for women and intoxication.
The path of salvation or the path of transcendental bliss retreated far far away from human society.
With the progression of the age of Kali people are becoming very proud.
They are becoming too much attached to women.
Women means I will explain this.
And intoxication.
Here women means objects of enjoyment.
Especially objects of sex pleasure.
This characteristic of Kali Yuga.
People are more and more and more after sex pleasure.
And they are very easily become attached and attracted.
Attracted and hence attached to enjoyment with the member of the opposite sex.
Whether women or men.
Women are attracted to men and men are attracted to women for sex pleasure.
This is the characteristic of Kali Yuga.
By the influence of the age of Kali.
Srila Prabhupada explains further.
Even a pauper is proud of his penny.
As far as pride is concerned.
There is no reason to be proud for a person who has very very very little money in his possession.
But even the poorest of poor fellow.
If he gets some money.
Little.
Few rupees let's say nowadays.
Few rupees.
He is very proud.
Oh I have so much wealth.
I am a very rich person.
He thinks like that.
He becomes proud.
The women are always dressed in an overly attractive fashion.
To victimize the minds of men.
You see.
The dressing fashion of the women in Kali Yuga.
Simply to attract men for sex enjoyment.
They dress in a very bad way.
And the man is addicted to drinking wine.
Smoking.
Drinking tea.
Chewing tobacco.
Etc.
All varieties of intoxication.
Hmm.
All these habits or so called advanced under civilization are the root causes of all irreligiosities.
And therefore it is not possible to check corruption, bribery and nepotism.
Lot of people talk about too much corruption.
Too much corruption.
How to root out this corruption?
So the root cause of corruption is being pointed out here.
What is it?
All these
Irreligiosities.
If people are addicted to intoxication.
They are addicted to sex pleasures.
They are addicted to more and more possessions.
Greed for possessions.
Because of which they become overly proud of possessing many things.
Then it is not possible to avoid corruption.
Man cannot check all these evils.
Simply by statutory acts and police vigilance.
But he can cure the disease of the mind by the proper medicine.
It is actually a disease which is within the mind.
This propensity for enjoyment by sinful activities is a disease of the mind.
And what is the cure for this?
The proper medicine for this disease of the mind.
It is the principles of austerity, cleanliness, mercy and truthfulness.
Which have to be followed by people in order to cure the mind of these propensities.
For sinful enjoyment.
Modern civilization and economic development are creating a new situation of poverty and scarcity.
With the result of blackmailing the consumers commodities.
We can see that so many goods are produced but they are not growing grains.
So many factories for manufacturing so many unnecessary things.
Anartha.
But the most essential.
Commodities.
Specially grains, fruits, vegetables.
Which is required for even survival.
Of the human beings and the animals.
That is not being produced enough.
This is the influence of Kali Yuga.
So Prabhupada advocates.
It is a very long purport.
We will.
Discuss this more in the next session.
I will stop here.
Thank you very much.
Hare Krishna.
